greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominators of expansion of 1/x+1/log(1-x).
comment: |A006232(n+1)|= numerator(r(n)), n>=1, with r(n) := sum(|stirling1(n,k)|*B(k+1)/(k+1),k=1..n), n>=1 and B(n): =A027641(n)/A027642(n) (Bernoulli numbers) and stirling1(n,m)=A008275(n,m), n>=m>=1; r(0) := 1/2.
formula: Denominators from e.g.f. 1/x + 1/log(1-x) (and of signed sequence from e.g.f. 1/x - 1/log(1+x)).
a(n) = denominator(r(n)), n>=0, with rational r(n) defined in one of the comments.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Sep 06, 2002
